name: After the War
description:
Year 2019, Manhattan. After a nuclear war.

Out of the ashes comes a hero, Jonathan Rogers, better known as "Jungle Rogers", the owner of the asphalt jungle. The only chance of survival is to reach the airdrop platform XV-238, located in the control base of the schizophrenic assassin professor McJerin, and to escape to outer colonies.

There is no easy way to do this. The game is a side-scrolling shoot 'em up, with thugs coming at you constantly, and a few moves to use on them. You must cross the dangerous streets of Manhattan, which have become over-run by feral thieves. Later you await the guardians of the scientific complex of McJerin.
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS, MSX | Combined View

A lower punch in the chest. 1st level common enemies die with just one blow.

Final Boos - The player's head is about to get smashed.

The first thug of this level.

Kick in the stomach. Always use combinations.

Another serious situation. Let's get rid of this thug first with a punch on his face.

No, I'm not for sale.

Kick in the face...

...And a very nice comic strip.

Something sharp on the back. Totally being screwed.

My turn now.

Code for Part II of After the War

Part II: level 1.
Starting point.

Dodging the UCAV´s crossfire.

Part II: level 1.
Firing at a sentry gun. A bomb exploded behind the player.

Part II: level 1.
A pack of sentry guns and UCAVs.

Part II: level 1.
Be swift and precise, every bit of energy as any quarter of a second are indispensable for the success in the next levels.

Part II: level 1.
Final confrontation with the guardian of this level.
- Are you ED-209's cousin?

Part II: level 1.
Every time you're hit you have to start the level all over again wasting precious time.
- Chill out man, I didn't want to offend you!

Part II: level 1.
The moment of the explosion. It will disintegrate with the blow and the level is complete.

Part II: level 2.
Few metres after the starting point. Be sure to have your weapon fully loaded. These guards are tough.

Part II: level 2.
Concentrate on targets of which fire power you can't duck... er... this is not the case thou...

Part II: level 2.
Not only they're extremely tough but they are also very fast drawing their weapons.

Part II: level 2.
Everyone breaks.

Part II: level 2.
Final Boss. A missile exploding in the back.

Part II: level 2.
The visual sensor of this machinery is about to get destroyed. First you have to focus on the "arms" of the mechanical beast...

Part II: level 2.
... than you have to blind it! For the strike, you have to hit its gunner incessantly.

Part II: level 2.
Bye bye. Going down for the last level.

Part II: level 3.
Accessing the last level.

Part II: level 3.
At this point it's expected to find "walkers" as common enemies. They're much more weaker than the final "mechs" though, and slightly different.

Part II: level 3.
Will there be time enough to dodge this one?

Part II: level 3.
The Final Confrontation. Missiles are your worst enemy at this point. A single one will put you directly at the start of the level.

Part II: level 3.
Blowing the missile launcher almost at the same time a missile is exploding just behind you.

Part II: level 3.
Finally it was destroyed. Tough one this one. Otherwise the player would be trampled like a smashed boiled potato.

Part II: level 3.
Finished.
To Be Continued...
